}} The '{{nfly|2010}} [[Denver Broncos]] [[List of Denver Broncos
seasons|season]]' was the franchise's 41st season in the National Football
League, the 51st overall and the 10th playing their home games at INVESCO Field
at Mile High. The off-season was marked by the draft selections of Georgia Tech
wide receiver Demaryius Thomas and All-American Florida quarterback Tim Tebow,
as well as season-ending injuries to All-Pro linebacker Elvis Dumervil and free
agent running back LenDale White. The team failed to improve on its 8â8 record
from 2009, and set a new franchise record for losses in a single season, with a
4â12 record. The regular season was marked by a videotaping scandal dubbed
[[Steve Scarnecchia|Spygate II]] and the firing of head coach Josh McDaniels.

The Broncos had the league's worst defense in 2010, allowing a league-worst 471
points (29.4 per game) and 6,253 yards. [http://www.pro-football-
reference.com/years/2010/opp.htm Pro-Football-Reference.com: 2010 NFL Opposition
& Defensive Statistics]
categories: 2010 National Football League season by team|Denver
